title: Trouble Reinstalling(Installing)
body:
Whats going on is my game got corrupted or at least wasn't launching correctly(It was scanning for non-existent files and got stuck). So I decided to reinstall, I removed it through windows control panel and made sure the league of legends file was deleted(C:\Riot Games\League of legends). I downloaded the installer and it did it's thing, but after launching the client it keeps the watermark[](https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/158404053821423616/242838603850448896/unknown.png) there and I assume its downloading the rest of the patcher/client but it just stays for awhile and then adventually disappears. To rule out some of the basic things I'm 100% sure I don't have a firewall running on my computer and I've tried running the file as both admin and non-admin, neither working out.  


To avoid pasting in a full log file I searched from the bottom to see where it ran into issues, if needed I can still paste the whole thing.

000001.822|   OKAY| Riot::RADS::Common::HTTPConnection::GetFile: ("/releases/live/projects/lol_patcher/releases/0.0.0.70/packages/files/BIN_0x00000000", "C:/Riot Games/League of Legends/RADS/temp/TMP2.tmp", 0x02D2F4FC)

replies.body:
It looks like your patcher is timing out before reaching our patching servers. This is most likely caused by certain network configurations that don't exactly play well with League. In this case, I'd work through our [connection guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) to ensure your settings are 100% compatible with League.

Let me know if those steps helped.

-Current Server Status: NA is doing fine
-Switch to a Wired Connection: I am using eithernet 
-Firewall Trouble: I don't have a firewall
-Configure DNS: I'm looking into im not on the issue computer right now <------
-Packet Loss/Buffering: Eithernet doesn't drop many packets, and I don't have anything running in the background, using Netstat to make sure everything non-windows or league isn't using network. 
-Port Forwarding: Again not on issue computer looking into this one <------
-Proxies: No proxies 
-Ipconfig:I use flushdns every once and awhile and also in this case, Ill explore the others<----- 

Thanks for the early response ill try these tonight.
Cool, let me know what changes.

I think I'm going to have to come to the conclusion my internet is way to slow right now to get that file downloaded before it times out. I think they are working on some stuff further down the line some business were having trouble so hopefully it speeds up later. 

Till another time, Have a great day
